00032 // Interface for Str type.
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 9/7/94
00035 
00036 #ifndef _str_h
00037 #define _str_h 1
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #ifdef WIN32
00046 #include <rpc.h>
00047 #include <winsock.h>
00048 #include <xdr.h>
00049 #else
00050 #include <rpc/types.h>
00051 #include <netinet/in.h>
00052 #include <rpc/xdr.h>
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #include <string>
00056 
00057 #include "dods-limits.h"
00058 #include "BaseType.h"
00059 
00060 
00061 // max_str_len should be large since we always send strings with length bytes
00062 // as a prefix (so xdr_string will always know how much memory to malloc) but
00063 // if deserialize gets confused and thinks a ctor (in particular) is a string
00064 // xdr_string in turn will max_str_len if it cannot get a length byte. A long
00065 // term solution is to fix DODS, but strings should not routinely be > 32k
00066 // for the time being... jhrg 4/30/97
00067 
00068 const unsigned int max_str_len = 32767; // DODS_UINT_MAX-1; 
00069 
00076 class Str: public BaseType {
00077 
00078 protected:
00079     string _buf;
00080 
00081 public:
00082     Str(const string &n = "");
00083 
00084     virtual ~Str() {}
00085 
00086     Str(const Str &copy_from);
00087 
00088     Str &operator=(const Str &rhs);
00089 
00090     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00091     
00092     virtual unsigned int width();
00093 
00094     // Return the length of the stored string or zero if no string has been
00095     // stored in the instance's internal buffer.
00096     unsigned int length();
00097 
00098     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00099                bool ce_eval = true);
00100     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00101 
00102     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00103     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00104 
00105     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "",
00106                bool print_decl_p = true);
00107 
00108     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "",
00109                bool print_decl_p = true);
00110 
00111     virtual bool ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset);
00112 };

00157  * Revision 1.32.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00158  * Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00159  * I added those where they were needed.
00160  * In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00161  * just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00162  * before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00163  * just good form when using delete.
00164  * I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00165  * making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00166  * set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00167  * comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00168  * characters on their own.
00169  *

00171  * Rearranged source files so that the CVS logs appear at the end rather than
00172  * the start. Also made the ifdef guard symbols use the same naming scheme and
00173  * wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00174  * down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00175  *
00176  * Revision 1.31  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00177  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00178  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00179  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00180  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00181  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00182  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00183  *

00264  * Changed the names of read_val and store_val to buf2val and val2buf.
00265  *
00266  * Revision 1.11  1995/03/04  14:35:05  jimg
00267  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00268  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00269  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00270  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00271  * class represenation.
00272  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00273  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00274  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00275  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00276  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00277  * C would store them.
00278  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00279  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00280  * objects).
00281  *
00282  * Revision 1.10  1995/02/10  02:22:48  jimg
00283  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00284  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00285  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00286  * will be removed in a future release.
00287  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00288  * internal buffer.
00289  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00290  * Fixed read_val().
00291  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00292  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00293  * Fixed print_val().
00294  *

00299  * mfunc read_val (to be consistant with the other mfunc names).
00300  * Removed the unnecessary duplicate declaration of the abstract virtual
00301  * mfuncs read and (now) read_val from the classes Byte, ... Grid. The
00302  * declaration in BaseType is sufficient along with the decl and definition
00303  * in the *.cc,h files which contain the subclasses for Byte, ..., Grid.
